remarks: A canonical version of ~ infxpen , by a completely different approach (although it uses ~ infxpen via ~ xpomen ).  Using Cantor's normal form, we can show that ` A ^o B ` respects equinumerosity ( ~ oef1o ), so that all the steps of ` ( _om ^ W ) x. ( _om ^ W ) ~~ _om ^ ( 2 W ) ~~ ` ` ( _om ^ 2 ) ^ W ~~ _om ^ W ` can be verified using bijections to do the ordinal commutations.  (The assumption on ` N ` can be satisfied using ~ cnfcom3c .)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 30-May-2015.) (Revised by AV, 7-Jul-2019.)
statement:
infxpenc.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. On ) $.
infxpenc.2 $e |- ( ph -> _om C_ A ) $.
infxpenc.3 $e |- ( ph -> W e. ( On \ 1o ) ) $.
infxpenc.4 $e |- ( ph -> F : ( _om ^o 2o ) -1-1-onto-> _om ) $.
infxpenc.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` (/) ) = (/) ) $.
infxpenc.6 $e |- ( ph -> N : A -1-1-onto-> ( _om ^o W ) ) $.
infxpenc.k $e |- K = ( y e. { x e. ( ( _om ^o 2o ) ^m W ) | x finSupp (/) } |-> ( F o. ( y o. `' ( _I |` W ) ) ) ) $.
infxpenc.h $e |- H = ( ( ( _om CNF W ) o. K ) o. `' ( ( _om ^o 2o ) CNF W ) ) $.
infxpenc.l $e |- L = ( y e. { x e. ( _om ^m ( W .o 2o ) ) | x finSupp (/) } |-> ( ( _I |` _om ) o. ( y o. `' ( Y o. `' X ) ) ) ) $.
infxpenc.x $e |- X = ( z e. 2o , w e. W |-> ( ( W .o z ) +o w ) ) $.
infxpenc.y $e |- Y = ( z e. 2o , w e. W |-> ( ( 2o .o w ) +o z ) ) $.
infxpenc.j $e |- J = ( ( ( _om CNF ( 2o .o W ) ) o. L ) o. `' ( _om CNF ( W .o 2o ) ) ) $.
infxpenc.z $e |- Z = ( x e. ( _om ^o W ) , y e. ( _om ^o W ) |-> ( ( ( _om ^o W ) .o x ) +o y ) ) $.
infxpenc.t $e |- T = ( x e. A , y e. A |-> <. ( N ` x ) , ( N ` y ) >. ) $.
infxpenc.g $e |- G = ( `' N o. ( ( ( H o. J ) o. Z ) o. T ) ) $.
infxpenc $p |- ( ph -> G : ( A X. A ) -1-1-onto-> A ) $.
